text: [Music]
I just completed the introductory lab on
running SharePoint server in
AWS I created a template that our
developers can use to deploy a
SharePoint instance when they need it it
saved me a lot of time not to mention
the cost savings
thanks that's awesome have you
considered moving test or production
instances to the AWS
Cloud hm I'm interested but concerned
that building a large SharePoint Farm is
a lot of work is it easy to deploy a
small SharePoint solution that is secure
and stable enough for use on production
sites yes you can deploy a production
SharePoint server farm with as few as
two servers whatever size of SharePoint
farm that you build you can use Amazon
VPC to create a network topology that
will ensure that your solution is secure
and highly
available what other servers are needed
for a multi-server SharePoint Farm
SharePoint servers have to be members of
an active directory domain and a
multi-server SharePoint Farm also needs
SQL Server so the minimum number of
servers would be four two for SharePoint
one for the active directory and one SQL
Server to provide the
database how do I integrate this with
active
directory you have a range of options
for a test environment you may want to
build a Standalone active directory
inside your VPC for production sites you
can extend your private on premises
Network to AWS so that the resources in
the AWS Cloud use your existing ad
infrastructure you can even deploy
domain controllers for your existing ad
Forest to the AWS Cloud this ensures
that the SharePoint servers deployed in
AWS remain functional and available in
the event of an on- premises outage you
can also use the AWS directory service
ad connector to proxy ad requests from
the cloud to your on premise ad
domain what options are available for
the database server you can install SQL
server in Windows Server instances and
you can use Microsoft license Mobility
through software Assurance to bring your
own licenses into the AWS Cloud Amazon
machine images for SQL Server Express
SQL Server web Edition and SQL Server
standard edition are also available for
launch on
AWS does everything need to be in the
AWS data centers we have databases
within our corporate Network that we
would like to keep on
premises you can keep as much as you
like on premises you can easily create a
VPC where instances in one subnet such
as web servers communicate with the
internet while instances in another
subnet such as application servers
communicate with databases on your
corporate Network an ipvpn connection
between your VPC and your corporate
Network helps secure all communication
between the application servers in the
cloud and database spaces in your data
center what if I find that the smaller
solution is not sufficient to meet my
needs will I have to deploy an entirely
new SharePoint Farm AWS cloud formation
and autoscaling make it easy to scale up
and down as your needs change you can
even change the size of your farm in
minutes do I have to build my SharePoint
Farms piece by piece or is there an
easier way to build them AWS also
provides a quick start reference guide
and an AWS cloud formation template free
of charge that can be used to deploy and
configure multi-server SharePoint farms
and it is ideal for deploying larger
environments can I modify the templates
for my needs sure AWS Cloud information
templates are Json files that specify
the configuration of the AWS resources
that make up your stack you can edit the
template and apply Version Control the
same way you do with code if you
maintain a version history of your
templates you can also roll back to
previous versions
so who's using the AWS Cloud for
SharePoint server
deployments customers find it especially
beneficial where the workload varies
because you can quickly scale up or down
as and when required companies are also
using AWS deployments as standby for
Disaster Recovery if the primary fails
the AWS deployment can be spun up
quickly to take over the workload
without the need for dedicated Hardware
how much does it cost AWS provides a
cost estimator calculator where you can
plug in the number and type of Amazon
ec2 instances you plan to deploy as
usual you only pay for what you use
there are no minimum fees and no upfront
commitments please complete the Hands-On
lab for this video at run. quiick laabs
docomo 90 minutes to complete
